title: Prime Time Wrestling: Sport or Drama, Two-Way Table
question_text: Shane and Emma have been having a big disagreement.  Although they both watch Prime Time Wrestling, Emma believes it is all drama - basically a soap opera for men!  Shane says no way!  "It's all sport" he claims. In order to investigate whether gender influences opinions, Shane and Emma conducted a survey of several randomly selected individuals who watch Prime  Time Wrestling.  Respondents were asked to choose between the following three options concerning their beliefs. ∙ It's All Sport ∙ It's All Drama ∙ It's Part Sport, Part Drama Responses was recorded separately for both men and women and are shown in the two-way table below. All Sport All Drama Part Sport, Part Drama Total Men 28 5 15 48 Women 17 10 14 41 Total 45 15 29 89 Which of the following correctly identifies the explanatory and response variables in this study?

choices.text: Explanatory Variable:  Opinion on Prime Time Wrestling Response Variable:  Gender
Explanatory Variable:  Gender Response Variable:  Opinion on Prime Time Wrestling
Explanatory Variable:  Male Response Variable:  Belief that Prime Time Wrestling is "All Drama"
Explanatory Variable:  Female Response Variable:  Belief that Prime Time Wrestling is "All Drama"
Since both variables of interest are categorical, either of the two variables could be considered the explanatory variable while the other variable would be considered the response variable.
